answers.answer: Well you aren't eating or really taking care of yourself, so no that is not normal.  I have seen it when people lose weight by not eating only 1 time a day, and others actually gain.  So, it happens, but it is in no way healthy and as a word of caution... you are very likely to gain 2 times what you have lost when you do start eating.  You are currently losing muscle = by not eating your body goes into "starvation mode" and is burning muscle, not fat.  It is much healthier to eat throughout the day than what you are doing.
Also... one other thing I thought of in regards to your title, rapid weight loss is a foe.  Healthy weight loss is 1-2 lbs per week.

question: Greetings!In the last four days, I have lost roughly 8 lbs. Some of you may think I am gloating, but I am just curious. A little background information first. I am a 6 foot, 18 y.o. male with no history of HIV exposure or any other medical conditions.During the school year I would eat 3 squares a day, including a snack twice a day. I played rugby (which is a great way to lose weight and gain girlfriends!) and tried to watch my weight. I weighed rougly 220 at the beginning of the season, and was down to a lean 207 after my final match. After the season had ended, I took on two jobs. My first job is the most active, its all manual labour. My second job is delivering chinese food. I work 14+ hours a day, with 7-8 of those hours being heavy lifting and just general being physical.In the last week, due to time constraints, I've made some lifestyle changes. I only eat 2 meals a day, and most days of the week I only ate one. I usually get less than 7 hours of sleep a night, but I do stay very hydrated during the day as well as taking a multi-vitamin. I have pretty good energy during the day with a ravenous apetite that I slake with plenty of food (none of it being healthy, usually its Chinese food from my resturant or on occasion fast food) at lunch time. Four days ago and I weighed 205 lbs. I woke up today and weighed 198 lbs. My girlfriend says I'm wasting away and even my dense little brother noticed I'm slimming down.I swear I'm not here to gloat! I am wondering, is this normal?
title: Rapid Weight Loss: Friend or Foe?
